datafield.subfield: Unstable nuclei in dissociation of light stable and radioactive nuclei in nuclear track emulsion

A role of the unstable nuclei$^{6}$Be,$^{8}$Be and$^{9}$B in the dissociation of relativistic nuclei$^{7,9}$Be,$^{10}$B and$^{10,11}$C is under study on the basis of nuclear track emulsion exposed to secondary beams of the JINR Nuclotron. Contribution of the configuration$^{6}$Be + n to the$^{7}$Be nucleus structure is 8 ± 1% which is near the value for the configuration$^{6}$Li + p. Distributions over the opening angle of α-particle pairs indicate to a simultaneous presence of virtual$^{8}$Be$_{g.s}$. and$^{8}$Be$_{2+}$ states in the ground states of the$^{9}$Be and$^{10}$C nuclei. The core$^{9}$B is manifested in the$^{10}$C nucleus with a probability of 30 ± 4%. Selection of the$^{10}$C “white” stars accompanied by$^{8}$Be$_{g.s}$. ($^{9}$B) leads to appearance in the excitation energy distribution of 2α2p “quartets” of the distinct peak with a maximum at 4.1 ± 0.3 MeV.$^{8}$Be$_{g.s}$. decays are presented in 24 ± 7% of 2He + 2H events of the$^{11}$C coherent dissociation and 27 ± 11% of the 3He ones. The channel$^{9}$B + H amounts 14 ± 3%. The$^{8}$B$_{g.s}$. nucleus is manifested in the coherent dissociation$^{10}$B → 2He + H with a probability of 25 ± 5% including 13 ± 3% of$^{9}$B decays. A probability ratio of the mirror channels$^{9}$B + n and$^{9}$Be + p is estimated to be 10 ± 1.
